gurmukhi: gx gMDRb dyv inhwrh gy ] jX s`d inn`d pukwrh gy ] jmfwNiF kiRpwxix bwhh gy ] AD AMg ADo AD lwhh gy ]312]
transliteration: Gad Gaddhrab Dev Nihaarah Ge|| Jaya Sadd Ninadd Poukaarah Ge|| Jamdaandh(i) Kridaanan(i) Baahah Ge|| Adh An Adho Adh Laahah Ge||312||
translation: Ganas, Gandharvas and gods will see all this and will raise the sounds of “hail, hail”; the axes and swords will be struck and the limbs, being cut into halves, will fall,312.

gurmukhi: rx rMg qurMgX bwjh gy ] fP JwNJ nPIrX gwjh gy ] Axxys duhUM ids Dwvh gy ] kir kwF kiRpwx kpwvh gy ]313]
transliteration: Ran Ran Turanad Baajah Ge|| Daph Jhaanjh Nabheeray Gadjah Ge|| Ananes Duhoon Dis Dhaavah Ge|| Kar(i) Kaadh Keipaan Kapaavah Ge||313||
translation: The intoxicated horses imbued with war, will neigh and the sound of anklets and small cymbals will be heard; the generals of both the sides will fall upon each other and will glisten their swords, while holding them in their hands.313.

gurmukhi: rx kuMjr puMj gr`jh gy ] lK myG mhwN duq l`jh gy ] irs mMf mhw rx jUth gy ] Ct C`qR CtwCt CUth gy ]314]
transliteration: Ran Kounjar Pounj Gadajjah Ge|| Lakh Megh Mahaan Dout Lajjah Ge|| Ris Mand Mahaa Ran Jeetah Ge|| Chhat Chhattra Chhataachhat Chhntah Ge||314||
translation: The groups of elephants will roar in the war-arena and seeing them, the clouds will feel shy; all will fight in anger and the canopies of chariots etc. will drop from the hands of the warriors very quickly.314.

gurmukhi: rxxMk inSwx idswx Gury ] gl g`j hTI rx rMg iPry ] kir kop kiRpwx pHwrh gy ] Bt Gwie JtwJt Jwrh gy ]315]
transliteration: Rananank Nishaan Disaan Ghure|| Gad Gadj Hathiran Ran Phire|| Kar(i) Kop Keipaan Prahaarah Ge|| Bhat Ghaae Jhataajhat Jhaarah Ge||315||
translation: The war-trumpets sounded in all the directions and the warriors raising shouts turned towards the war-arena; now in their fury, they will strike blows with their swords and will quickly inflict wounds on the warriors.315.

gurmukhi: kir kwF kiRpwx kpwvh gy ] klkI kl kiRq bFwvh gy ] rx lu`Q plu`Q ibQwrh gy ] qk qIr su bIrn mwrh gy ]316]
transliteration: Kar(i) Kaadh Keipaan Ghor Ghamakkah Ge|| Kalkikal Keit Badhaavah Ge|| Ran Loutth Paloutth Bithaarah Ge|| Tak Teer Su Bderan Maarah Ge||
translation: Taking out his sword in his hand and glistening it, Kalki will increase his approbation in the Iron Age; he will scatter the corpse upon corpse and aiming the warriors as targets, he will kill them.316.

gurmukhi: Gx GuMGr Gor Gm`kh gy ] rx mo rx qIr pl`kh gy ] gih qyg JVwJV JwVh gy ] qp qIr qVwqV qwVh gy ]317]
transliteration: Ghan Ghounghar Ghor Ghamakkah Ge|| Ran Mo Ran Teer Palakkah Ge|| Gadh Trg Jhadaajhad Jhaadah Ge|| Tap Teer Tadaatar Taadah Ge||317||
translation: The thick clouds will rush forth in the war-arena and in the winking of the eye, the arrows will be discharged; he will hold his swords and strike it with a jerk and the crackling noise of the arrows will be heard.317.

gurmukhi: gj bwj rQI rQ kUth gy ] gih kysn eyikn JUth gy ] lK lwqn muSt pHwrh gy ] rx dwNqn kysnu pwrh gy ]318]
transliteration: Gad Baaj Rath Kootah Ge|| Gadh Kesan Ekan(i) Jhootah Ge|| Lakh Laatan Mousht Prahaarah Ge|| Ran Daantan Kesan(u) Paarah Ge||318||
translation: The elephants, horses, chariots and chariot-riders will be chopped and the warriors catching each other by their hair, they ill swing; there will be blows of legs and fists and the heads will be shattered with teeth.318.

gurmukhi: Avxys AxIix suDwrh gy ] kr bwx kiRpwx sMBwrr gy ] kir ros duhUM ids Bwvh gy ] rix sIJ idvwlX pwvh gy ]319]
transliteration: Avnes Aneen(i) Sudhaarah Ge|| Kar Baan Keipaan Sanbhaarah Ge|| Kar(i) Ros Duhoon Dis Bhaavah Ge|| Ran(i) Seejh Divaalaya Paavah Ge||319||
translation: The kings of the earth will re-array their armies and hold their bows and arrows; there will be fought a dreadful war in anger in both the directions and the warriors will obtain a place in heaven in the dreadful war.319.

gurmukhi: CxxMk kiRpwx Cx`kh gI ] JxxMik sMjoA Jx`kh gI ] kxxMiCk Dwr kx`Ch gy ] rx rMig su cwcr m`ch gy ]320]
transliteration: Chhananank Kridaan Chhanakkah Gee|| Jhananaaak(i) Sanjoa Jhanakkah Gee|| Kanananchhik Dhaar Kanachchhah Ge|| Ran Ran(i) Su Chaachar Machchah Ge||320||
translation: The swords will clatter and the jingling of the steel armours will be heard; the sharp-edged weapons will produce knocking sounds and the Holi of the war will be played.320.

gurmukhi: duhUM Er qy swNg An`ch gI ] jit DUr Durw rMg r`ch gI ] kr vwr ktwrIA b`jh gI ] Git swvx jwxu su g`jh gI ]321]
transliteration: Douboon Or Te Saan Anachchah Gee|| Jatteedhoor Dhuraa Ran Rachchah Gee|| Kar Vaar Katdareea Bajjah Gee(i)|| Ghattee Saavan Jaan(u) Su Gadjab Gee||321||
translation: The lances will be struck from both sides and the matted locks of the warriors will roll in dust; the spears will collide while striking blows like the thundering of the clouds of Sawan.321.

gurmukhi: Bt dwNqn pIs irswvh gy ] duhUM Er qurMg ncwvh gy ] rx bwx kmwxix Corh gy ] hX qRwx snwhin Porh gy ]322]
transliteration: Bhat Daantan Pees Risaavah Ge|| Duhoon Or Turan Nachaavadge|| Ran Baan Kamaanan(i) Chhodhah Ge|| Haya Traan Sanaahan(i) Phorah Ge||322||
translation: The warriors grinding their teeth in anger will cause their horses to dance from both sides; they will discharged arrows from their bows in the war-arena and will cut the saddles of horses and the armours.322.

gurmukhi: Git ijau Gix kI Guir FUkh gy ] muK mwr dso ids kUkh gy ] muK mwr mhwN sur bolh gy ] igr kMcn jy mn folh gy ]323]
transliteration: Ghattee Jio Ghan(i) Kighur(i) Dhookah Ge|| Moukh Maar Daso Dis Kookah Ge|| Moukh Maar Mahaan Sur Bolah Ge|| Gir Kanchanndje Man Dolah Ge||323||
translation: The warriors will rush forth like clouds and will roam in all the ten directions, shouting,”kill, kill”; with their utterance of “kill, kill”; the heart of Sumeru mountain will all move.323.

gurmukhi: hX kot gjI gj ju`Jh gy ] kiv kot khwN lg bu`Jh gy ] gx dyv Adyv inhwrh gy ] jY s`d inn`d pukwrh gy ]324]
transliteration: Haya Kot Gadigad Jujjhah Ge|| Kavi Kot Kahaan Lag Bujjhah Ge|| Gad Dev Adev Nihaarah Ge|| Jai Sadd Ninadd Poukaarah Ge||324||
translation: Crores of elephants and horses and also the riders of elephants will die fighting. To what extent the poet will describe them? The ganas, gods and demons will all see and hail.324.

gurmukhi: lK bYrK bwn shwvh gy ] rx rMg smY Phrwvh gy ] br Fwl Flw Fl FUkh gy ] muK mwr dso ids kUkh gy ]325]
transliteration: Lakh Birakh Baan Sahaavah Ge|| Ran Ran Samai Phahraavah Ge|| Bar Dhaal Dhalaa Dhal Dhookah Ge|| Moukh Maar Daso Dis Kookah Ge||325||
translation: Lakhs of lances and arrows will be discharged and the banners of all colours will wave in the war-arena; the superb warriors will fall on the enemies taking their shields etc. and in all the ten directions the sound of “kill, kill” will be heard.325.
